bug.short_desc: No access to Firefox menus right of Apple menu

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Randomlly can't access Firefox 4 menus right of Apple menu (including Apple menu), need to either close all windows or restart Firefox via Finder click then force quit from the Apple menu. All other parts of Firefox work just fine, even the menu's on the toolbar.
Reproducible: Couldn't Reproduce
Steps to Reproduce: I wish I could reproduce the effects. It just does it when it wants too, only in Firefox. Looks like a OS X + Firefox issue as everything else in FF works fine. Reinstalling/no add-ons has no change, still randomly occurs. The whole top menu becomes unresponsive. Thanks folks, undoubtedly the best browser in the world and awesomely fast as well.
Add-on installed. Ad Block Plus, Back To Top, Click&Clean, Close Tab by Double Click, Dictionary Tool Tip, Flagfox, Ghostery, Locator, Make Address Font Bar Size Bigger, New Tab Homepage, NoScript, NoSquint, SmoothWheel, Status-4-Evar, Tab Scope, Theme Font & Size Changer, TinEye Reverse Image Search, WOT, HTTPS Everywhere.
17" MacBook Pro Quad, 10.6.7
